node.title: Philippines tells China to 'back off' after clash in South China Sea
node.alt: A Chinese coast guard ship is seen in the distance in the South China Sea.
node.description: Philippine authorities say the Chinese coastguard fired water cannons and blocked boats carrying supplies to troops at a disputed atoll in the South China Sea.
node.content:
["The Philippine government says three Chinese coast guard vessels blocked and fired\u00a0water cannons at two supply boats headed towards a Philippine-occupied atoll in the South China Sea this week.", "The incident prompted swift condemnation from Philippine Foreign Secretary Teodoro Locsin, who warned Beijing\u00a0the vessels are covered by a mutual defence treaty with the United States.", "Mr Locsin said no one was hurt during the incident at Second Thomas Shoal, but the boats had to abort their mission to deliver food to Philippine\u00a0forces on the atoll.", "Mr Locsin said he had conveyed \"in the strongest terms\" to China's ambassador in Manila \"outrage, condemnation and protest of the incident.\"", "The office of President Rodrigo Duterte, who has been a staunch supporter of China, said it was aware of the incident at the shoal.", "\"We will continue to assert our sovereignty, sovereign rights, and jurisdiction,\" acting spokesperson Karlo Nograles said.", "", "
The Philippines has occupied the Second Thomas Shoal since it intentionally grounded its navy ship the Sierra Madre there in 1999.\u00a0(Pool via AP:\u00a0Ritchie B. Tongo)
", "
Clash the latest in long-running territorial dispute
", "The Second Thomas Shoal is located 195 kilometres off Palawan and is within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone.", "China regards the shoal as its territory as it falls within the 'nine-dash line'\u00a0it uses on maps denoting its claim to almost the entire South China Sea.", "A small Philippine military contingent have occupied the atoll since 1999 after intentionally grounding a warship known as the Sierra Madre on the reef.\u00a0", "In 2016, a case brought to the Permanent Court of Arbitration at The Hague by Manila\u00a0ruled in favour of the Philippines, with the court finding that China had no historical title over the waters of the South China Sea.\u00a0", "Mr Locsin said China's failure to exercise self-restraint \"threatens the special relationship\" between the two countries.", "", "
China's territorial claims cut through many of its neighbours' claims, including the Philippines.\u00a0(ABC News: Illustration/Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "
Resupply mission to go ahead, Philippine authorities say\u00a0
", "Philippine National Security Adviser Hermogenes Esperon\u00a0said\u00a0during the incident,\u00a0two Chinese coast guard ships blocked the two wooden-hulled supply vessels.\u00a0", "A third coast guard ship, Mr Esperon said, \u201cwater cannoned the two [vessels] for one hour\", the impact causing one of the ship's outriggers to be displaced.", "Mr Esperon said\u00a0Philippine authorities\u00a0planned to deploy coast guard and Bureau of Fisheries vessels to back up its forces at Second Thomas Shoal.\u00a0", "\u201cWe will continue the resupply and we do not have to ask the permission of anybody because that is within our territory,\u201d Mr Esperon said.", "There was no immediate comment from Chinese officials in Manila or Beijing.", "ABC / wires"]
